Thank you for the torrent, I've been wanting to play this game for a long time and now that I've played it I can summarize it in 2 words: IT SUCKS! This port at least is awful.

The is a resource hog and worst thing is that you can't even change the video settings to match you PC. Making a game for the PC and locking the video settings is like shooting yourself in the foot, my PC is quite good and the game still runs at under 20 fps most of the time and if I should ever use force powers to break some of the environment the frame rate drops to about 1-2 fps until the debris disappear. Even when the game runs smooth it feels slow and boring.

After waiting to play it so much I have to say it's a disappointment. For me this port feels like it's been made just to get some extra cash from the PC fan-base instead of delivering on the fans expectations.

Score: 3/10

Ok people. I have played this crapy game for about two hours, and I can say that this game is truly piece of crap.

And here is why
1.I resent the hype that creators were giving us.
2. 24GB of space, come on, that is just bad and lazy ass console to PC porting
3.It's fucking dull, just hack and slash, and loads of it.
4.when you die the fucking game sets you back like 5 minutes, and that is fucking too long.This is a game killer for me, I'm not gonna loose time like that.
5.graphic is pretty good, but not 24GB good.And you cannot change it.WTF.I have quad core on 3Ghz and 8800GT 512MB, and game runs smooth with no glitches, but not everybody owns config like me.
6.Oh yeah, last but not the least.When you slash someone with your saber, it's like you are hiting them with a club, not a laser that would cut of limbs or dissecting body parts, blood flying.What kind of shit is that, I'll tell you what kind, censorship kind shit for kiddies.Game killer also.

If you like star wars play KOTOR 1 and 2, or star wars academy, at least it's not dull.Just skip this, it's hack and slash for kiddies (7-12).

OK, ready for some positive comments on this game? :P First, let's get the obvious out of the way:

1: 24GB is a bit much, but just clear the space for it and uninstall after you've played it, if it's bothering you.

2: Graphics are really great, but it is very annoying that you can't adjust the advanced settings.

3: The controls can be a bit sloppy at times, but nothing out of the ordinary.

HOWEVER:
I've just finished playing the whole game, and I can promise all the other fans of the Jedi Knight series, that while it's not as good as any of those, it's extremely entertaining, much more destructive, and most definitely worth a play-through. There are some great scenes, and the technologies you get to play with are a great deal of fun. My experience was all in all very positive.

I have an early 2008 MacBook Pro:
2,5 Intel Core Duo
GeForce 8800 512 MB
3GB RAM

And at 800x600 (widescreen mode), it ran smoothly. Except for a few second in the beginning of some stages.

I didn't actually check the other resolutions provided, because I got so caught up in it, I didn't even notice :P

And you get a great perspective on the story between episode 3 and 4 of the Star Wars films. The game feels very authentic and loyal to the universe, with everything from background music to animation.. I'm still a little hyped, I guess :P 

But mostly because people can't stop talking shit about this game, even when it's such a good experience, even for the nostalgic fans of the trilogy, such as myself.

Okay guys, just to be nice I'll write a nice comprehensive guide.

1. Download this torrent.
2. Use virtual CD/DVD mounting software (Daemon Tools Lite or Slysoft Virtual Clone Drive) and create two virtual drives.
3. Mount both ISOs (don't know how to mount? use Google)
4. Run the installer located on the first ISO
5. Let it install.
6. When prompted, it will ask for the second ISO
7. Using the window that pops up, browse to the second virtual drive with the second ISO mounted
8. Resume installing
9. Once installed, download and install the 1.1 patch: http://ve3d.ign.com/articles/news/51334/Star-Wars-The-Force-Unleashed-Ultimate-Sith-Edition-PC-Patch-v1-1-Released

This patch has MANY, and I mean MANY bugfixes.  Many parts of the game will freeze in specific areas without this patch!
10. Once the patch is installed, go to gamecopyworld and get the patched EXE for version 1.1 of SWTFU:USE
11. Download the patched EXE, and copy it over the original SWTFU.exe located wherever you installed the game
12. Unmount your ISOs, disable your virtual drives
13. Delete the ISOs if you wish (I keep backups)
14. Play the game!

Note: To play the Hoth, Tatooine, and Jedi Temple bonus levels, you must create a new game BUT make sure it is saved to an empty slot and not your existing one.

Have fun everyone.

There is no trust because everyone wants the same jobs, the same resources and the same small percentage of wealth. Over 95 percent of the world?s wealth is owned by less than 1 percent of the population.

Politicians know this but are trapped in the system just like everybody else. Political success requires massive amounts of funding to be pumped into campaigns and advertising. 1) The system isolates people from one another by giving them conflicting interests from their competition. The way it hides this is by uniting the people in hatred of something else.

Unity is everything provided we face the right enemy. Tell people who the enemy is. They will not believe you, so be patient and persist. Do not let ignorance destroy us.

2) Do not have anything to do with the military.

The military takes orders from the government, but the government takes orders from the banking industry. War is about profit because the system is a business and not a charity. The best way to convince men to fight is to make them want to fight. Think about it.

3) Know your enemy.

The system that lets most people suffer in poverty and a few to wallow in self-indulgence because of bloodline or blind luck is the enemy. This is the same system the Romans used, and will end in the same way. The greed of a few is holding back evolution for the rest.

The heart of the enemy is the banking industry. The banking industry perpetuates debt and most horrifyingly of all, it keeps people static. It weighs them down with car loans, mortgages, personal finance, stock options, credit cards, overdrafts etc..... The point is to keep you in permanent debt, and therefore an employee of the bank until you die. Everybody works for the banks: the only difference lies between those that know it and those that don?t.
